Message.Msg: Obama wants to increase taxes and the debt limit without budget cuts. I could go for increased taxes on the top 2% with legislation that would prevent another debt limit increase until the budget is balanced. This will allow Congress the time to make the necessary cuts without worsening the problem while we wait for them to do their jobs. If the administration can't take this step then I agree, Shut It Down! att
Fair enough. Finally no more "tax cuts for the rich"! Tired of this nonsense. So, heck with this economy. And sure, still need to cut a lot.

Message.Title: All Financials UP

Real smelly. Quite the turnaround, flopping on the floor and everybody and their brother taking pot shots. The latest being Wells Fargo with a note citing no confidence in the capital plan. Lowering next year numbers due to shrinking and less revs. Clowns running the show. Period......

Message.Title: Horrah, unemploymment at 3.8%
Message.Msg: For government workers.... Elections have consequences, and to bad for the poor slubs looking for work who cast a ballot for the job creator. 73% of New Jobs Created in Last 5 Months Are in Government Seventy-three percent of the new civilian jobs created in the United States over the last five months are in government, according to official data published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. In June, a total of 142,415,000 people were employed in the U.S, according to the BLS, including 19,938,000 who were employed by federal, state and local governments. By November, according to data BLS released today, the total number of people employed had climbed to 143,262,000, an overall increase of 847,000 in the six months since June. In the same five-month period since June, the number of people employed by government increased by 621,000 to 20,559,000. These 621,000 new government jobs created in the last five months equal 73.3 percent of the 847,000 new jobs created overall.
**Clowns running the show** No, it's the Fed and QE4 that's pushing up the financials.
Do you have any idea how much higher rates and a steeper yield curve would help all banks? Clowns running the show at Etrade. I hear Bozo does animal balloons at lunchtime for all the kiddies.
WHile back Etfc, Rimm, and Bac were all trading at $7.50 per share. Total dog list. Today.... Rimm $12 Bac $10.64 Eturd $8.37
why would anybody "invest" in etrade?, really
btw how much did they pay for all the gs strategic advice??
